protocol.text: Whole seedlings were harvested at 1 pm 5 days post germination and immediately shock frozen in liquid nitrogen.
Arabidopsis seeds were surface sterilized, stratified for 2 d at 4deg C and plated onto MS plates. Seedlings were grown for 5 days at 21 deg C and a 18 h light 6 h dark light cycle.
Total RNA was extracted using the Qiagen RNeasy kit according to the manufacturers protocol
cDNA was produced from RNA samples using  an oligo-dT primer. cDNA served as a template to produce amplified amounts of biotin-labeled antisense mRNA using in vitro transcription.

Biotin-labeled RNA was fragmented and added to standard cocktail of salts, blocking agents and bacterial RNA spikes. The cocktail was hybridized with the ATH1 Genechip at 45 degrees Celsius for 16 hours. After hybridization, the chip was stained with the biotin binding agent, streptavidin-phycoerythrin. Staining signal amplification was amplified using an anti-Streptavidin antibody (goat) and biotinylated goat IgG antibody.

Arrays were scanned using the Affy 3000 7G scanner, and data extracted from the scan using Affymetrix GeneChip Expression Console with standard settings. Images processed using GeneChip Operating Software (GCOS) (Affymetrix).
Data were analyzed with the limma package embedded in the Robin software using RMA normalization. P-values were corrected using Benjamini Hochberg multiple testing correction.
